posts.post_content:
It is so strange to me to see such high power, low toughness creatures in green. There certainly are a fair number of them, but most of them due to their mana costs appear as fatties with their butts shrunken rather than cheap things with razor teeth.   
  
Honestly, taking another look at it, there's always been Deadly Insect, Yavimaya Ants, etc. Just funny is all, given how they emphasized shifting high power low toughness away from black, because it was making it too similar to red.
posts.html:
It is so strange to me to see such high power, low toughness creatures in green. There certainly are a fair number of them, but most of them due to their mana costs appear as fatties with their butts shrunken rather than cheap things with razor teeth.

Honestly, taking another look at it, there's always been Deadly Insect, Yavimaya Ants, etc. Just funny is all, given how they emphasized shifting high power low toughness away from black, because it was making it too similar to red.

posts.post_content: To me it really feels like a lovechild of the two Wolfir cards from Avacyn Restored: [Wolfir Avenger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wolfir Avenger) and [Wolfir Silverheart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wolfir Silverheart) in that it's a ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) flash creature that can alternatively give what may as well be seen as +4/+4 for ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) across "two creatures" since when the creature this enchants dies, it becomes a 4 power creature (or this could be seen as "similar to the Avenger's regenerate ability")-- unfortunately it can't provide as good of a surprise defense but considering it's like both cards into one, I would say it's still very powerful
posts.html:

Posted By: Ogonomany (9/19/2013 11:23:34 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is a strong boon that I intend to bestow upon an unblocked [Fabled Hero](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fabled Hero).  
  
[Boon Satyr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boon Satyr) is arguably the strongest card in Theros showcasing the Bestow mechanic, the only other challenger being [Nighthowler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nighthowler). The flexibility granted by the low casting cost, the manageable Bestow cost, and the surprise factor of Flash gives this card enormous potential, depending on the metagame. And remember that, in general, four power for three mana is a fairly credible threat.  
  
@Xpodmaniac: According to Rule 303.4d, "an Aura that's also creature can't enchant anything." When you Bestow a creature, it loses its creature card type until it's not enchanting anything. (Otherwise, Bestow wouldn't work at all.) Also, it loses its Satyr creature type as long as it's an Aura, because only creatures and tribals can have creature types (Rule 205.1a).  
  
The reminder text has two clues to help you answer your question: 1) the text lacks "in additi... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

This card is a strong boon that I intend to bestow upon an unblocked Fabled Hero.

Boon Satyr is arguably the strongest card in Theros showcasing the Bestow mechanic, the only other challenger being Nighthowler. The flexibility granted by the low casting cost, the manageable Bestow cost, and the surprise factor of Flash gives this card enormous potential, depending on the metagame. And remember that, in general, four power for three mana is a fairly credible threat.

@Xpodmaniac: According to Rule 303.4d, "an Aura that's also creature can't enchant anything." When you Bestow a creature, it loses its creature card type until it's not enchanting anything. (Otherwise, Bestow wouldn't work at all.) Also, it loses its Satyr creature type as long as it's an Aura, because only creatures and tribals can have creature types (Rule 205.1a).

posts.post_content:
Well this is an awesome card. But I have to wonder...  
  
If I cast it for its Bestow cost, then is it still a creature while it's enchanting another creature? Could [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) destroy it while it's Bestowing its abilities? What if I cast [Black Sun's Zenith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Sun's Zenith) with x at 2... would that kill this guy, even while he's an Aura?  
  
And probably biggest of all... while he's an Aura, enchanting a creature... could I still swing with him?  
  
Perhaps the answer's obvious and has been staring me in the face for days but I'm still curious.
posts.html:
Well this is an awesome card. But I have to wonder...

If I cast it for its Bestow cost, then is it still a creature while it's enchanting another creature? Could Doom Blade destroy it while it's Bestowing its abilities? What if I cast Black Sun's Zenith with x at 2... would that kill this guy, even while he's an Aura?

And probably biggest of all... while he's an Aura, enchanting a creature... could I still swing with him?

Perhaps the answer's obvious and has been staring me in the face for days but I'm still curious.
